greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference of (product of runlengths of 1-bits) and (product of runlengths of 0-bits) in binary representation of n.
comment: The sequence seems to consist of palindromic subsequences centered around each (2^k)-1 and 2^k (with end points near the terms of A000975), which is easily explained by symmetric pairing of binary expansion of n and its complement.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10922
maple: a:= proc(n) local i, j, m, r, s; m, r, s:= n, 1, 1;
for i from 0 while irem(m, 2, 'h')=0 do m:=h od;
for j from 0 while irem(m, 2, 'h')=1 do m:=h od;
mathematica: a[n_] := With[{s = Split @ IntegerDigits[n, 2]}, Times @@ Length /@ Select[ s, First[#]==1&] - Times @@ Length /@ Select[s , First[#]==0&]]; Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 28 2016 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 08 2013
